name: Oaxaca Old-Fashioned
description: Some rye or bourbon, sugar, Angostura bitters and a twist: The old-fashioned cocktail is a dependable formula. Here, tequila and mescal take whiskey's place in a south-of-the-border spin on the traditional recipe. Invented in 2007 at Death & Co. in the East Village, by the tequila specialist Philip Ward, this drink quickly started appearing on menus across the country.
recipeIngredient: Strip of orange peel with pith, one inch wide

recipeInstructions.text: Combine liquids in a cocktail shaker with a generous handful of ice. Stir until well chilled. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.

Hold a lighted match over drink in one hand and orange peel in other hand, with orange side facing flame and about an inch away. Carefully and quickly squeeze orange peel until oils spark. Put out match and drop peel into cocktail.
